channel.title: CiTR -- ANoize
channel.description: An hour and a half of Avant Rock, Noize, Plunderphonic, Psychedelic, and Outsider aspects of audio. An experience for those who want to be educated and EARitated.

item.title: Broadcast on 24-Oct-2007
item.description: A pretty cool show where we debut the 180 G's. A gospel, acapella doo-wop group who do nothing but NEGATIVLAND covers!
item.itunes:subtitle: Negativland Doo-Wop

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Oct-2007
item.description: First half hour we feature the Industrial side of Exotica with some Throbbing Gristle, 23 Skidoo and YMO with Martin Denny and Yma Sumac thrown in for good measure. Second half hour features the Guitars Guitars festival with some Borebetomagus, Khanate and AMM. The last half hour is some acoustic-ness with the Ed Askew reissue (fuckin great) Harris Newman and the new Thurston.
item.itunes:subtitle: Exotica, Guitar Noise, Acoustic Prettiness

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Sep-2007
item.description:
A very stupid opening 1/2 hour featuring Negativland ,Spike Jones ,Zoviet France,Unclean Weiner,The Frogs,Wild Man Fischer,Dupobs ,Mike Watt coverinn Blue Oyster Cult,Beach Boys,and Butthole Surfers
Noisy Weirdness with Cloudland Canyon,Animal Collective,WZT Hearts ,White Rainbow,Thurston Moore,Clockcleaner,Pissed Jeans, and Pterodactyl
And to end some very old AMM for the Nurse List quotient.
item.itunes:subtitle: Very Stupid...

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Sep-2007
item.description: Beatnik stuff featuring Jack Kerouac, Ken Nordine and Rod McUen, Bass and Drum stuff featuring The Ruins, Whitey Houston and Godhedsilo. Achim Reichel is the Nurse list song.

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Sep-2007
item.description: Guitar based noise including Bison, High on Fire, Mono, Lightning Bolt and a really bad joke about pirates.
item.itunes:subtitle: Normal show...

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Sep-2007
item.description: Sonic Youth covering Neil Young sounding like Kraftwerk...Liars sounding like JAMC...Animal Collective sounding like The Residents...Necronomicon sounding like nothing you've ever heard before.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lotsa Technical Screw-ups

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Jan-2007
item.description:
'Everything Has To End...'
"On January 18th 2004, Strictly Kev premiered the original 'Raiding The 20th Century' on XFM's 'The Remix' show in London. It was a 40 minute attempt to catalogue the history of cut up music - be it avant garde tape manipulation, turntable megamixes or bastard pop mash ups. It rapidly spread throughout the web and managed to cause a full scale server crash on boomselection.info when they hosted it due to the volume of net traffic.
Shortly afterwards he read Paul Morley's recently published book 'Words & Music' and was amazed that certain chapters mirrored parts of his mix. Apart from the fact that the title, 'Raiding the 20th Century' was coined by Morley 20 years before for a future Art of Noise project, he also featured Alvin Lucier, who - purely by chance - was sampled on the opening track of the mix.
Kev decided to expand his idea to make the defnitive document on cut up music including many other parts, omitted by the constraints of the original radio session. After months of further research he tracked Morley down and they recorded passages from 'Words & Music' specially for this mix in an attempt tomarry the two and finish something that neither of them actually started. A year to the day of the original airing, the newly expanded version is ready."
